item.title: Fire Spread Modeling using Probabilistic Cellular Automata
item.description: arXiv:2403.08817v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: A cellular automaton (CA)-based modeling approach to simulate wildfire spread, emphasizing its strengths in capturing complex fire dynamics and its integration with geographic information systems (GIS). The model introduces an enhanced CA-based methodology for wildfire prediction, emphasizing interactions between neighboring cells and incorporating major determinants of fire spread, including wind direction, wind speed, and vegetation density, while also accounting for spotting and probabilistic transitions between states in the model to mirror real-world fire behavior.
item.dc:creator: Rohit Ghosh, Jishnu Adhikary, Rezki Chemlal
